intro: Faramea hassleriana, commonly known as the Brazilian wax tree, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, waxy leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Faramea hassleriana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
